original_statement_1: Kangaroos use their tails for balance.
negation: Kangaroos do not use their tails for balance.

rephrases.statement: Kangaroos rely on their tails to maintain equilibrium.
rephrases.negation: Kangaroos do not rely on their tails to maintain equilibrium.

rephrases.statement: A kangaroo's tail aids in balancing.
rephrases.negation: A kangaroo's tail does not aid in balancing.

term_1_statements.negation: Kangaroos are not native to Australia.

term_1_statements.statement: Kangaroos carry their young in pouches.
term_1_statements.negation: Kangaroos do not carry their young in pouches.
Kangaroos are not primarily aquatic animals.

term_2_statements.negation: Not all mammals have tails.

term_2_statements.statement: Tails are used for communication by some animals.
term_2_statements.negation: Tails are not used for communication by some animals.
Tails do not generate photosynthesis.

term_2_statements.statement: Every animal on Earth has a tail.
term_2_statements.negation: Not every animal on Earth has a tail.

term_3_statements.negation: Balance is not important for movement.

term_3_statements.statement: Humans use their ears to help maintain balance.
term_3_statements.negation: Humans do not use their ears to help maintain balance.

term_3_statements.statement: Elephants balance on their trunks when sleeping.
term_3_statements.negation: Elephants do not balance on their trunks when sleeping.

term_3_statements.statement: Humans have a third leg for balance.
term_3_statements.negation: Humans do not have a third leg for balance.

rephrases.negation: Lions do not primarily consume plants.
Lions do not eat a plant-based diet.

term_1_statements.negation: Male lions do not have manes.

term_1_statements.statement: Lions are part of the feline family.
term_1_statements.negation: Lions are not part of the feline family.
Lions are not native to Antarctica.

term_1_statements.statement: Lions are a species of bird.
term_1_statements.negation: Lions are not a species of bird.

term_2_statements.negation: Herbivores do not eat only plants.
Cows are not herbivores.
Not all herbivores can fly.
Herbivores do not consume meat.

original_statement_3: Whales are marine mammals that breathe air.
negation: Whales are not marine mammals that breathe air.

rephrases.statement: Whales, while living in the sea, breathe atmospheric air.
rephrases.negation: Whales, while living in the sea, do not breathe atmospheric air.

rephrases.statement: In spite of being marine creatures, whales breathe air.
rephrases.negation: In spite of being marine creatures, whales do not breathe air.

term_1_statements.statement: Whales are the largest animals on Earth.
term_1_statements.negation: Whales are not the largest animals on Earth.
Whales do not live in deserts.

term_2_statements.negation: Cats are not marine animals.
Coral reefs are not marine ecosystems.

term_2_statements.statement: A desert is a marine habitat.
term_2_statements.negation: A desert is not a marine habitat.
Penguins are not marine birds.

term_3_statements.statement: Mammals give birth to live young.
term_3_statements.negation: Mammals do not give birth to live young.
Mammals do not have mammary glands.

term_4_statements.statement: Air is composed primarily of nitrogen and oxygen.
term_4_statements.negation: Air is not composed primarily of nitrogen and oxygen.
Humans do not need air to breathe.

term_4_statements.statement: Air can be seen with the naked eye.
term_4_statements.negation: Air cannot be seen with the naked eye.

term_4_statements.statement: Air is primarily made of helium.
term_4_statements.negation: Air is not primarily made of helium.

rephrases.statement: Bats are active during the day.
rephrases.negation: Bats are not active during the day.

rephrases.statement: The daytime is when bats typically function.
rephrases.negation: The daytime is not when bats typically function.

term_2_statements.negation: Most birds are not diurnal.

term_2_statements.statement: Diurnal is the opposite of nocturnal.
term_2_statements.negation: Diurnal is not the opposite of nocturnal.

term_2_statements.statement: Diurnal creatures are active during the night.
term_2_statements.negation: Diurnal creatures are not active during the night.
Owls are not primarily diurnal birds.

negation: Giraffes do not have short necks.

rephrases.statement: The neck of a giraffe is short.
rephrases.negation: The neck of a giraffe is not short.

rephrases.statement: Short necks are a characteristic of giraffes.
rephrases.negation: Short necks are not a characteristic of giraffes.

term_1_statements.negation: Giraffes do not have spotted coats.

term_2_statements.negation: Humans do not have necks.

term_2_statements.statement: Necks connect the head to the body.
term_2_statements.negation: Necks do not connect the head to the body.
Frogs do not have elongated necks.

term_2_statements.statement: The throat is the back part of the neck.
term_2_statements.negation: The throat is not the back part of the neck.

original_statement_6: Pigs wallow in mud to regulate temperature.
negation: Pigs do not wallow in mud to regulate temperature.

rephrases.statement: Pigs use mud as a way to lower their body temperature.
rephrases.negation: Pigs do not use mud as a way to lower their body temperature.

rephrases.statement: To cool off, pigs often immerse themselves in mud.
rephrases.negation: To cool off, pigs do not often immerse themselves in mud.

term_2_statements.negation: Mud is not wet soil.

term_2_statements.statement: Mud is often used in beauty treatments.
term_2_statements.negation: Mud is not often used in beauty treatments.

term_2_statements.statement: Mud was never used in construction.
term_2_statements.negation: Mud was used in construction.

term_2_statements.statement: All deserts are filled with mud.
term_2_statements.negation: Not all deserts are filled with mud.

term_3_statements.statement: Temperature can be measured in Celsius or Fahrenheit.
term_3_statements.negation: Temperature cannot be measured in Celsius or Fahrenheit.

term_3_statements.statement: The temperature of steam is higher than the temperature of ice.
term_3_statements.negation: The temperature of steam is not higher than the temperature of ice.

term_3_statements.statement: The temperature in Earth's core is lower than the temperature on its surface.
term_3_statements.negation: The temperature in Earth's core is not lower than the temperature on its surface.

term_3_statements.statement: Absolute zero is the temperature where particles have the highest kinetic energy.
term_3_statements.negation: Absolute zero is not the temperature where particles have the highest kinetic energy.
